GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO (GTI_HANDLE_TYPE hpid, GTI_UINT32_TYPE nMemAccessID, GTI_MEM_LEVEL_INFO *pInfo)
 GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO() - Query for memory level definitions.

Detailed Description

This header defines the GTI APIs for accessing memory of the target device.

The memory APIs use a common set of parameters that are documented here:

page is used for architectures that support separate memory pages (e.g. C55x has separate program, data, and i/o pages).

count is the number of memory "units" to read. A memory unit size is determined by how memory is addressed by target device. If memory locations are byte addressable, then a single unit is 8 bits. If memory locations are 16-bit addressable, then a single unit is 16 bits.

attr defines optional parameters for the memory accesses. These are:
GTI_ATTR_SHARED - Memory access is to shared memory.
GTI_ATTR_CACHE - Memory access should update caches only.
GTI_START_DOWNLOAD - Memory write is the first of a download.
GTI_END_DOWNLOAD - Memory write is the last of a download.
GTI_CONTINUE_DOWNLOAD - Memory write is a continuation of a download.
Note that the DOWNLOAD parameters are to help the driver optimize writing large quantities of data. Once the client begins a download by using the GTI_START_DOWNLOAD parameter with a memory write, no other GTI API calls should be made to any targets until the download is complete. Once a download has begun, sending a write with GTI_END_DOWNLOAD is required to end it; you may send a zero length write with this parameter if needed.
GTI_ATTR_READ_VERIFY - Request driver to read verify a memory write.
GTI_ATTR_CACHE_BYPASS - Bypass the cache (C62x & C67x only).

strAttr defines optional parameters for memory accesses as strings. The only two attributes supported this way are "|$$SHARED" for access to shared memory and "|CACHE" for accesses that should only update the caches.

accessSize sets how many bits are accessed at a time by the debug hardware. Use GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_NONE to have the driver choose the optimal access size. Use GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_BYTE, GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_HALF, or GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_WORD to force the driver to use 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit accesses respectively.

buf is an array of 32-bit elements. The number of elements must be equal to the count parameter. Each element of the buf array will hold only one memory unit. So that if the target's memory is byte addressable, each element in buf will contains just a single 8 bit value. The caller allocates this array.

mem_access_id is a collection of bit flags to determine what memory and caches levels will be accessed. It is used to, for example, write to a single cache level, or to bypass a cache. The meaning of these bits are determined through the GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO() API. Using -1 for this is the default meaning "CPU view" of memory.

pMem_status_buf is an array of GTI_STRUCT_MEM_STAT structures that return status information for each memory unit accessed. This may be set to NULL to skip returning status information. The caller allocates this array.

Copyright (c) 1998-2015, Texas Instruments Inc., All rights reserved.

Define Documentation

#define GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_BYTE   0x0001

Force memory access to 8-bit width.

#define GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_HALF   0x0002

Force memory access to 16-bit width.

#define GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_NONE   0x0000

Memory access width sizes.

Used by GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT(), GTI_READMEM_BLK(), GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT(), and GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK(). Default, let driver choose access size.

#define GTI_ACCESS_SIZE_WORD   0x0004

Force memory access to 32-bit width.

#define GTI_ATTR_CACHE   0x00008000

Memory access should update caches only.

#define GTI_ATTR_CACHE_BYPASS   0x00080000

Bypass the cache (C62x & C67x only).

#define GTI_ATTR_READ_VERIFY   0x00040000

Request driver to read verify a memory write.

#define GTI_ATTR_SHARED   0x00000100

Memory attribute flags.

Used by GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT(), GTI_READMEM_BLK(), GTI_READMEM_EX(), GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT(), GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK(), and GTI_WRITEMEM_EX(). Memory access is to shared memory.

#define GTI_CONTINUE_DOWNLOAD   0x00030000

Memory write is a continuation of a download.

#define GTI_END_DOWNLOAD   0x00020000

Memory write is the last of a download.

#define GTI_MEM_ACCESS_REVISION   (2)

Revision of the GTI_MEM_LEVEL_INFO and GTI_MEM_LEVEL_ATTRIB structures.

#define GTI_START_DOWNLOAD   0x00010000

Memory write is the first of a download.

#define MEM_LEVEL_MAX_NAME   (30)

Maximum length for a memory level name used by GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO().

#define TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_EXT_EXPORT

Export attribute for GTI_READMEM_BLK() and GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK().

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum GTI_ENUM_MEM_RESULT

Memory access status result values.

Used by GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT(), GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT_64(), and GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT().

Enumerator:
GTI_MEM_STAT_PASS 

Memory access succeeded.

GTI_MEM_STAT_FAIL 

Memory access failed.

GTI_MEM_STAT_SECURITY 

Memory access caused security violation.

GTI_MEM_STAT_NOT_PRESENT 

Memory requested is not present in the specified memory level.

GTI_MEM_STAT_INVALID 

Memory access was invalid.

GTI_MEM_STAT_NOT_ATTEMPTED 

Memory access request was not attempted.

GTI_MEM_STAT_MMU_FAULT 

Memory access caused an MMU fault.

enum GTI_MEM_ACCESS_BIT_TYPE

Memory level bit types used by GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO().

Enumerator:
GTI_MEM_ACCESS_RESERVED 

Bit is undefined/unused.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_QUERY 

Bit a query op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_MEM_LEVEL 

Bit is a memory/cache level.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_OP_MMU_CURRENT 

Bit is a bypass the MMU op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_OP_COHERENT 

Bit is an access coherency op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_OP_PRIORITY_BYPASS 

Bit is a bypass/coherency priority op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_OP_ENDSTATE_RATIONAL 

Bit is an end state of the target op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_OP_MMU_STAGE2_CURRENT 

Bit is a bypass the second stage MMU op.

GTI_MEM_ACCESS_BIT_MAX 

Marks end of list.

enum LINE_SIZE_T

Cache line size for memory attributes used by GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO().

Enumerator:
LINE_SIZE_NONE 

Line size 0 bytes, no cache.

LINE_SIZE_2B 

Line size 2 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_4B 

Line size 4 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_8B 

Line size 8 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_16B 

Line size 16 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_32B 

Line size 32 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_64B 

Line size 64 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_128B 

Line size 128 bytes.

LINE_SIZE_MAX 

Marks end of list.

enum REGION_SIZE

Enumerator:
REGION_SIZE_NONE 

Invalid region size.

REGION_SIZE_0 

Region size = 0.

REGION_SIZE_512B 

Region size = 512 B.

REGION_SIZE_1KB 

Region size = 1 kB.

REGION_SIZE_2KB 

Region size = 2 kB.

REGION_SIZE_4KB 

Region size = 4 kB.

REGION_SIZE_8KB 

Region size = 8 kB.

REGION_SIZE_16KB 

Region size = 16 kB.

REGION_SIZE_32KB 

Region size = 32 kB.

REGION_SIZE_64KB 

Region size = 64 kB.

REGION_SIZE_128KB 

Region size = 128 kB.

REGION_SIZE_256KB 

Region size = 256 kB.

REGION_SIZE_512KB 

Region size = 512 kB.

REGION_SIZE_1MB 

Region size = 1 MB.

REGION_SIZE_2MB 

Region size = 2 MB.

REGION_SIZE_MAX 

Marks end of list.

Function Documentation

GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  nMemAccessID,
GTI_MEM_LEVEL_INFO *  pInfo 
)

GTI_GET_MEM_LEVEL_INFO() - Query for memory level definitions.

This function enables the client to enumerate through the possible mem_access_id bits to determine what memory levels and operations are possible for the target device. This should be called with nMemAccessID set to a different bit (0 to 30) to learn the meaning of each bit. Bit 31 always has the meaning "default CPU view" when set no matter what other bits are set to support legacy behavior. The caller allocates the GTI_MEM_LEVEL_INFO structure and GTI_MEM_LEVEL_ATTRIB structure used by this call and sets nRevision to GTI_MEM_ACCESS_REVISION.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]nMemAccessIDValue (0 to 30) of the mem_access_id bit to query.
[in,out]pInfoPointer to return meaning of the mem_access_id bit.
TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_EXT_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_READMEM_BLK ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf 
)

GTI_READMEM_BLK() - Read target memory with access size.

This function reads a block of memory from target device. This call extends GTI_READMEM_EX() by letting caller choose a specific access width for the memory access.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory read.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to read.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[out]bufBuffer to return read data.
Examples:
CortexA8_Linux_Example.cpp, CortexA8_PRSC_Example.cpp, and GTI_API_Example.cpp.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_READMEM_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf 
)

GTI_READMEM_EX() - Read target memory.

This function reads a block of memory from target device.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory read.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to read.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[out]bufBuffer to return read data.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf,
GTI_INT_TYPE  mem_access_id,
GTI_STRUCT_MEM_STAT *  pMem_status_buf 
)

GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT() - Read target memory with status.

This function reads a block of memory from target device. This call extends GTI_READMEM_BLK() by letting caller choose specific memory levels to access and by returning status for each memory unit accessed.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory read.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to read.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[out]bufBuffer to return read data.
[in]mem_access_idMemory level access flags.
[out]pMem_status_bufBuffer to return status results.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT_64 ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS64_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf,
GTI_INT_TYPE  mem_access_id,
GTI_STRUCT_MEM_STAT *  pMem_status_buf 
)

GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT_64() - Read target memory with 64-bit memory addresses.

This function reads a block of memory from target device. This call extends GTI_READMEM_WITH_STAT() by adding support for 64-bit memory addresses.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory read.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to read.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[out]bufBuffer to return read data.
[in]mem_access_idMemory level access flags.
[out]pMem_status_bufBuffer to return status results.
TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_EXT_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf 
)

GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK() - Write target memory with access size.

This function writes a block of memory on target device. This call extends GTI_WRITEMEM_EX() by letting caller choose a specific access width for the memory access.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory write.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to write.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[in]bufBuffer with data to write.
Examples:
CortexA8_Linux_Example.cpp, CortexA8_PRSC_Example.cpp, and GTI_API_Example.cpp.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_WRITEMEM_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf 
)

GTI_WRITEMEM_EX() - Write target memory.

This function writes a block of memory on target device.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory write.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to write.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]bufBuffer with data to write.

GTI_INT_TYPE  mem_access_id,
GTI_STRUCT_MEM_STAT *  pMem_status_buf 
)

GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT() - Write target memory with status.

This function writes a block of memory on target device. This call extends GTI_WRITEMEM_BLK() by letting caller choose specific memory levels to access and by returning status for each memory unit accessed.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory write.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to write.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[in]bufBuffer with data to write.
[in]mem_access_idMemory level access flags.
[out]pMem_status_bufBuffer to return status results.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT_64 ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS64_TYPE  startAddress,
GTI_PAGE_TYPE  page,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_MEM_NUM_ATTR_TYPE  attr,
GTI_MEM_STR_ATTR_TYPE  strAttr,
GTI_WAIT_STATE_TYPE  waitState,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_DATA_TYPE *  buf,
GTI_INT_TYPE  mem_access_id,
GTI_STRUCT_MEM_STAT *  pMem_status_buf 
)

GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT_64() - Write target memory with 64-bit memory addresses.

This function writes a block of memory on target device. This call extends GTI_WRITEMEM_WITH_STAT() by adding support for 64-bit memory addresses.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]startAddressStarting address of memory write.
[in]pageMemory page to access.
[in]countNumber of memory units to write.
[in]attrOptional parameter flags.
[in]strAttrOptional parameter string.
[in]waitStateSet wait states (unused).
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[in]bufBuffer with data to write.
[in]mem_access_idMemory level access flags.
[out]pMem_status_bufBuffer to return status results.
